input: what are the internet speed plans for home plans?
prediction:
Swisscom offers a variety of home internet plans tailored to different needs. One popular option is the blue Internet L plan, which provides speeds of up to 10 Gbit/s for both download and upload with a fibre optic connection. This plan includes a free WLAN router and a 6-month Disney+ Standard subscription with ads. Additionally, you can benefit from a Combi Discount if you have an existing blue Mobile subscription.

input: how can I add eSim to my iphone?
prediction:
Adding an eSIM to your iPhone is a straightforward process. First, ensure your iPhone is compatible with eSIM. Then, follow these steps:

1. Go to "Settings" on your iPhone.
2. Tap "Cellular" or "Mobile Data."
3. Select "Add Cellular Plan."
4. Use your iPhone's camera to scan the QR code provided by Swisscom.
5. Follow the on-screen instructions to complete the setup.

If you need a new eSIM or QR code, you can order it for free through My Swisscom. For more details, visit the Swisscom eSIM page.

https://www.swisscom.ch/en/residential/help/mobile/esim.html

Do you have any other questions about using eSIM on your iPhone?

input: How can I change my home address?
prediction:
To change your home address with Swisscom, you can easily update it through your My Swisscom account. Simply log in, navigate to the "Settings" or "Profile" section, and update your address details. This ensures that all your services and correspondence are sent to the correct location. If you encounter any issues or need further assistance, feel free to contact Swisscom customer support at 0800 555 155, available Monday to Saturday from 8:00 to 20:00.

Is there anything else you need help with regarding your Swisscom services? You can also explore more about managing your account on our website:

https://www.swisscom.ch/en/residential/help.html

input: What are the steps for transferring my current Swisscom number to a new account?
prediction:
Transferring your current Swisscom number to a new account is a straightforward process. First, you'll need to choose the new Swisscom subscription that suits your needs. During the registration process, you will be asked if you want to keep your existing number. Simply provide your current number, and Swisscom will handle the transfer for you. This service is free of charge and typically takes a few days to complete. 

If you need more personalized assistance or have specific questions, feel free to contact Swisscom customer support at 0800 555 155, available Monday to Saturday from 8:00 to 20:00. 

For more details on mobile subscriptions, you can visit Swisscom's website:
https://www.swisscom.ch/en/residential/mobile.html

input: What is the difference between your basic and premium mobile plans?
prediction:
Swisscom offers a range of mobile plans to suit different needs, including basic and premium options. Our basic plans, like the blue Mobile S, provide unlimited calls, SMS, and data within Switzerland, with surfing speeds up to 100 Mbit/s. On the other hand, premium plans, such as the blue Mobile L, offer more extensive benefits, including unlimited calls and data in the EU/UK, 1 GB data per year outside these regions, and surfing speeds up to 2 Gbit/s. Additionally, premium plans often include options for multiple devices and international calls.

Would you like more details on a specific plan or assistance in choosing the right one for you? You can explore all our mobile subscriptions here:

https://www.swisscom.ch/en/residential/mobile.html
